bio.summary: There are more acts with the name Flink: 1. Flink was founded in 2003. In 2005 they released their debut album ontheoutsideoflife on Little Jig Records, which was recorded 2004 in Sweden at the Mission Hall Studio with Mathias Oldén (engineering, co-producing), bass player from Logh. Their debut was awarded with the "Kick Ass-Award" from Radio 3fach and they played more than 30 gigs throughout Switzerland, where they supported Nada Surf (USA), The Soundtrack Of our Life (SE), The Feelers (NZ) and logh (SE) among others. Read more on Last.fm
bio.content: There are more acts with the name Flink: 1. Flink was founded in 2003. In 2005 they released their debut album ontheoutsideoflife on Little Jig Records, which was recorded 2004 in Sweden at the Mission Hall Studio with Mathias Oldén (engineering, co-producing), bass player from Logh. Their debut was awarded with the "Kick Ass-Award" from Radio 3fach and they played more than 30 gigs throughout Switzerland, where they supported Nada Surf (USA), The Soundtrack Of our Life (SE), The Feelers (NZ) and logh (SE) among others. Songs from the first album were played on Couleur 3, DRS3, Radio 3fach, Toxic FM, Kanal K and Radio Rabe, the Song someday, somehow appeared on the "Swiss Rocks" Compilation (SonyBMG) and the Hell Yeah Luzern Rock City Sampler 2006 from Little Jig Records. In 2007 Flink released their 2nd album moog on Swift note Records. Santi Garcia (who did great records with Favez, Standstill, Tokyo Sex Destruction, Houston Swing Engine) recorded it at his Ultramarinos Studio in Sant Feliu (Costa Brava). Music: Their music might be best described as indie rock, very melodic, a bit melancholic, with beautiful guitars and nice compositions, marching "monkey" drums and vocals that are not too pushy. Members: Jonathan Winkler, git & back voc Martin Brabec, git & voc Hannes Herger, bass Adi Schmid, drums 2. Heavy Metal Roma band Flink from Ostrava (Czech Republic) with heavy influence of Judas Priest, even Iron Maiden, and Accept .After the death of Jan Liček the band fell apart. 3. Flink was a Dutch band featuring singer Binne Meijer. They worked together with LINK, an organisation from the city of Delft who organized monthly shows about religion in the Delft Flora theater.
